page.title: 06HEALTH IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: Corbridge Health Centre opened in 1984,costing 250,000 pounds.Three doctors cover 35 square miles and serve a population of five to six thousand.The practice has a dispensary for patients living more than one mile from a chemist.The doctors work includes care of acute illnesses but the main proportion of their work is the management and control of chronic illness.Preventative medicine is also their concern with patients requiring regular blood pressure checks,cervical smears,immunisation and baby clinics. The doctors form part of a team,which includes District Nurse,Health Visitor Social Worker and Community Psychiatric Nurse. 80% of the District Nurses work involves caring for the elderly.Health Visitors care for the welfare of under fives and elderly.
